meanings.sent1: The preamble of the book explained the main idea.
meanings.sent2: The teacher read the preamble before starting the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow served as a preamble to her demanding breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The colorful sunrise was nature's preamble to a beautiful day.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell acted as a cheerful preamble to the school day.

meanings.definition: A preliminary or preparatory statement; an introduction.
meanings.sent1: The committee drafted a preamble to outline their goals.
meanings.sent2: The preamble set the stage for the important discussion.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was the perfect preamble to the delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: The first raindrops were a preamble to the coming storm.
meanings.sent5: The opening chords of the music were a powerful preamble to the concert.
